description.narrative: Disaggregated data and analytical evidence on monetary and multidimensional child poverty, and information on public social sector spending are available to inform advocacy and programming.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Disaggregated data and analytical evidence on monetary and multidimensional child poverty, and information on public social sector spending are available to inform advocacy and programming.

description.narrative: In 2019, 407,343 people gained access to basic sanitation and hygiene services thanks to interventions in communities, construction of basic sanitation services in institutions and capacity building with the Government. Sanitation in institutions was improved through the construction of latrines in 17 schools, and hygiene promotion including handwashing activities in 123 schools and 23 health facilities. 504,030 people and 56,964 schoolchildren (including 29,052 girls) have improved awareness on hygiene practices to prevent Cholera and Ebola. This is the result of partnership with the Government and NGOs and funding from the DFID, SIDA, CERF, UNICEF Natcoms in Germany, France, USA. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:27/12/2019
